intro: Oxytropis kashemiriana, commonly known as Kashmir bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
